qas.question: What was the most important discovery that led to the understanding that Earth's lithosphere is separated into tectonic plates?
Which parts of the Earth are included in the lithosphere?

answers.text: the crust and rigid uppermost portion of the upper mantle
crust and rigid uppermost portion of the upper mantle
crust and rigid uppermost portion of the upper mantle
crust and rigid uppermost portion of the upper mantle

qas.question: What is another word for the Earth's upper mantle?
Plate tectonics can be seen as the intimate coupling between rigid plates on the surface of the Earth and what?
In what decade was seafloor spreading discovered?
When was the most important discovery about thermal boundaries made?
What is another word for seafloor spreading?
What direction do sea currents and seafloor spreading always move in?

plausible_answers.text: coupling between the movement of the plates on the surface and the convection of the mantle

qas.question: What is involved in sea current coupling?
What is another term for sea currents?
What are the different tectonic plates called?

plausible_answers.text: the oceanic lithosphere is the rigid upper thermal boundary layer of the convecting mantle

qas.question: Why do oceanic plates and mantle convection currents move in opposite directions?
What is the lower thermal boundary layer called?
What are the lithosphere and asthenosphere called when coupled together?

context: <b5_0>In <a4_0>the <a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><b13_0>1960s<b13_0/><b5_0/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>, a series of discoveries, the most important of which was <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3>seafloor spreading<a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, showed that the Earth's lithosphere, which includes <a1_0>the <a1_1><a1_2><a1_3>crust and rigid uppermost portion of the upper mantle<a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, is separated into a number of <b14_0>tectonic plates<b14_0/> that move across the plastically <b10_0>deforming, solid, upper mantle<b10_0/>, which is called the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><b6_0>asthenosphere<b6_0/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. There is an intimate <b8_0>coupling between the movement of the plates on the surface and the <a3_1><a3_2>convection of the mantle<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/>: oceanic plate motions and mantle convection currents always move <b7_0>in the same direction<b7_0/>, because <b11_0>the <b12_0>oceanic lithosphere<b12_0/> is the rigid upper thermal boundary layer of the convecting mantle<b11_0/>. This coupling between rigid plates moving on the surface of the Earth and <a3_0><a3_3>the convecting mantle<a3_3/><a3_0/> is called <b9_0>plate tectonics<b9_0/>.
